lines.text: Uh, what it is you do, Mr. Staggliano?
College professor.
Oh! Uh, what do you teach?
College stuff. What are you, a fucking cop?
My car doesn't drive so well with a tree in it.
How do I look?
If I were a guy, I'd do you.

[on the phone]
Why won't you talk to me?

[on the phone]
Because there's nothing to say.
[Jack appears from behind "Jane's" car]
Then why are you here?
I'll protect her.
From what? From love?
From pain.

Love *is* pain! Life is pain. You can't protect anybody from it, it's always gonna get you. But sometimes, life could also be good. But you got to be open. You got to takes chances. You got to let go!
I'm sorry, Page. I'm a terrible mother. I'm a terrible everything.

[comforting her]
You're finally seeing things clearly.
Do you have any idea how much therapy you people need?
Look, I'm willing to explore the whole being dominated thing, okay? But let's just take it slow.

[to Jack]
Listen, mouth-breather, I'm fully capable and in the mood to beat the shit out of your psychotic, sulking ass!
Look, just give it to me, or would you rather have my heel up your ass?
Who told you I'm into that?
Isn't that the shoe you wanted to jam up my ass?
No, that was the 6" heel.

[on a deserted beach at night]
You're not out here burying high school kids, are you?
Well, they egged my car.
Tell me to my face you don't love me.
I don't love you.
Wow. More believable than I thought it would be.
No more conning! No more! If you're gonna be my wife, you're gonna live a respectable life, chopping cars!
There's no love. It's the trick of the brain. It's the combination of chemicals and hormones.
You spy on people humping in boats? That's so perverted.
No, I look at stars.
Look, just because they're famous doesn't mean they don't deserve their privacy too. Who ya got?
The stars up there.
[points to sky]
You mean you come all the way out here to stare at space and shit?
No, I come out here to get away from the lights of the city so I can SEE the space and shit.
I am in terrific shape. Feel my butt!
Uh, I am not feeling your butt again, Mother. We all know it's wonderful.
Why can't we pick someone kinda cute?
Dean was kinda cute.
You're in serious denial.
Cute is dangerous. Cute leads to feeling, which leads to screwing, which leads to screwed.
You gold-diggin' whore, you're already working someone else!
[points a gun at Tensy]
Get off of her, asshole. Get off, asshole!
Don't shoot him, Dean.
Why not?
Because he's already dead.
Shut up, junior slut! Get over there! Ya know, you two got some brass balls in those panties, I'll give ya that. And in the few moments you have left, I wanna see some beggin' and some pleadin'.
[points gun at Max and Page]
Uh, Mom...
Dean... you've got so many tells. You are not the killing type.
Don't screw with me. I'm on a fine edge, here. Don't!

[takes gun from Dean and opens it]
See... no bullets.
Fine. So I'm not that big on homicide!
Hi. Can I get you a drink?
Wow! I've never heard that one before. You really blow me away with your creativity.
Well, I...

"Well, I, uh..." Your recovery's even better! Do you even care at all who I am? I mean, I could be the Antichrist or have the intelligence of a thermos, but unfortunately *those* are not the matters the male penis ponders. So please tell me, why did you walk all the way over here to ask to get me a drink?
Well, because... I'm the bartender.

[catching Dean with another woman before their marriage was consumated]
You just lost the best thing you never had.
Forget it. You're not gonna kill yourself and stink up my new car.
Well, Jack, looks like she got a free drink *and* one of your balls.

[to Jack]
Since you can't seem to read my subtle signals, I'll help you out. Piss! Off!

[bursting into Jack's bar]
I want my purse, jerk-off!
That's not very friendly. Now, I want you to go back out, and this time, when you kick the door open, say something nice.

[standing firm]
You stole my purse, dip-shit, and you stole it so I'd have to see your ugly-ass face again.
God is everywhere.
Yes, he is. Isn't he? Nosy bastard.

[greeting Page-as-Wendy at her interview]
Sorry I'm late. I've been passing out more frequently lately.
For once, she's telling the truth!
Like I'm gonna believe the seed of Satan!
We have a bitch alert!
I love a woman who eats raw meat.

[seeing a fancy cigarette lighter]
Ah, a... personal fire device.
So much loudness. Can we not go somewhere I can relate to you... orally?
I'm sorry, sir, but smoking is not permitted.
Oh, terribly sorry.
[drops cigarette in her wine glass]
Nazi...

[regarding the cigarette lighter present]
I'm not trying to get you to take up smoking, just thought it'd be a nice... incentive.
Marry me... again.
He doesn't look so bad in this light.
Oh, yeah. His liver spots are positively glowing.
Excuse me, may I grab your nuts? Mmm. Salty.
Is it hard?

[nervously looks at his crotch]
What?
Getting married.
Wait by the phone. Timing on this is crucial.
Duh!
[walks away from car window]
...Always treating me like a child...
Child.
I'd have to kiss that?
Well, I'd have to kiss that way more than you.
Maybe you're into necrophilia.

[showing the statue to "Ulga"]
Completely restored. Only seven thousand for a new willy.
You will respect your mother and do the con.
Keep dreaming, witch!
You are not too old to spank!
Try it!

[watching Page manhandle a cigarette machine]
Oh, yeah... she's a delicate flower.

[considering Tensy as their next mark]
Hmm...
Not "hmm"! I am not dating the walking dead!
One penis coming up, Mom!

[to Jack throughout the movie]
I gotta go.

[on a fishing boat]
Look at all the fish!
[pulls his gun out and starts shooting at the water]
Huh, got it. This is gonna be a fun trip!
Maybe you'd like a spanking?
Just try it. I dare you!
Honey! Honey! This isn't what it looks like. I... I... I swear her hair got stuck in my zipper. I-I-I-I wasn't gettin' nothin'.
Have you any idea what that meat is doing to your arteries?
Haven't you heard? Cigarettes dissolve cholesterol.
Mothers are death.
Can't argue there.

[excusing Page's volatile behavior]
Everyone's a little irritable after they choke.
Smoking is part of the fun of being a kid. We just did some tests on some 9-year-olds. After a little puking, why, you couldn't drag 'em away from the stuff. Heh-heh-heh.
[cough]
You're only young once. Why not indulge, though, I always say.
There is nothing sexier than smoke billowing proudly out of a woman's hot, red, engorged nostrils.

You *are* good. You may not know it, but I *do*. You come on tough, but it's all just an act. I mean, you don't even believe in sleeping together before marriage. You're like a Brady or an Osmond or something.

[slipping the arresting officer cash as he takes a housekeeper to jail]
If it's at all possible, could you slap her around a little bit?

[advancing upon Olga]
My love, tonight we will celebrate this ecstatic joining of our spirits with the union of our aching bodies.
I ache for you, my pumpkin. Let's hump.
Angela, I've changed. I've totally changed. Look, look, look! This place is crawling with prime trim; I'm barely even noticing.

[upon seeing Tensy in his undershirt and shorts, w/fake Russian accent]
Oh my gootness! Dat ees jarring!
[first lines]
Do you, Angela Nardino, take Dean Cumanno as your lawfully wedded husband? To love, honor, and obey, 'til death do you part?
I do.
I've assumed my husband always filed the tax return.
Which one?
You're not ready to con a guy without falling in love yourself.
Give me a break, I am in complete control!
I saw the kiss. Your eyes were closed.
That was the sun!
The last time the sun got in my eyes, I wound up with a daughter.
Yeah, and that's about the worst thing that's ever happened to you, isn't it?
Turning down a wedding gift is bad luck.
Oh, I've never heard that before.
Sure, everything to do with weddings is bad luck.
[last lines]
I never realized I could feel this wa again. That I could be so totally in love with someone.
Oh, I feel the same way Stanley...
You're beautiful.
Thank you.
[watching with binoculars and a big grin]
